answers.answer: There are approximately a dozen different skin conditions with Latin type names having detailed explanations for each. Posting here would take up lots of space. I suggest you use Google search on "diabetes skin conditions" w/o the " " [quotes]. It returned a number of pages with useful information.

question: My mom has diabetes.  Recenltly, she broke out with little bumps on her legs.  At first they itched, but now they have left hard black cores like black heads and are sore to the touch.  The doctor told her to apply neosporin twice a day.  They sent a sample to be tested, but I was wondering if you could give me some information.
title: sores on a diabetic
